page.title: 02Granbrook Farm Mickleton
page.content: We visited Mr Hoggins at his farm.He told us it is a farm of 160 acres,90 of which are pasture and forty are for hay.His farm is a mixed farm,mostly dairy and some arable.The crops which are grown are mostly cereals.Most of these are sent to a corn merchant.The cereals that are grown are winter wheat and spring barley.Mr Hoggins uses a crop rotation system for his crops.The only crop used on the farm is hay which is fed to the cows.His cows are Friesians and he has 35 of them. When his cows calve he has to decide which calves to sell and which to keep He sells the bull calves and keeps the heifers.He sells them to a merchant. He feeds the calves on dried milk powder,sugar beet pulp and cow cake.
